stories.title: Access a fully hosted personal Kubernetes dev cluster

stories.text:
I have been looking to use lipsync for a project at work, and I have been horrified to see that the most used deepfake library [0] with over 30k stars has the word "test" mentioned in it a whopping 10 times. This naturally made me very hesitant to use this library as who (I guess no one, really) knows how unstable it may be.

Are there any examples of projects in ML (other than libs like pytorch) that do have test suites, and perhaps even enforce TDD? Would be very curious to know.

[0] DeepFaceLab https://github.com/iperov/DeepFaceLab
stories.title: Are there any open source ML libraries that have good (or any) test coverage?

stories.text:
Hey everyone! My startup whispercash.com just got an interview with Ycombinator this upcoming Wednesday Dec 1st. We would be extremely grateful if anyone can practice a mock interview with us in the following days! You can schedule a call with us on this link https://calendly.com/andreykocevski/ycombinator

About us, we've raised 250K so far, we are in the Central Bank Digital Currency industry, we have an advisor team with industry insiders, and our founding team has past experience building similar stuff. You can check us out at whispercash.com
stories.title: Ask HN: Y Combinator Mock Interview Practice?
